sailpoint.integration

Class XmlUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.integration.XmlUtil

  • public class XmlUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for creating and parsing XML.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  XmlUtil.SailPointEntityResolver
      Custom entity resolver that handles different locations.

      Custom error handler that just throws exceptions.

      • unescapeAttribute

        Unescape an XML attribute - this is the inverse of escapeAttribute().

      • escapeContent

        public static void escapeContent(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                                 java.lang.String s)
        Differs from escapeAttribute in that we don't escape quotes. Also handles the ]]> CDATA ending sequence. Technically we should be doing that for attributes but we never try to store escaped XML in attribute content.

      • escapeContent

        public static java.lang.String escapeContent(java.lang.String s)
        Escape the given element content.

      • escapeContent

                                 java.lang.String s)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Escape the given element content and stream it to a Writer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Serialize the given Node into the given StringBuilder.

      • addContent

        public static void addContent(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                              java.lang.Object o)
        Replaces special characters in a string with XML character entities. The characters replaced are '&' and '<'. This should be when building strings intended to be the values of XML attributes or XML element content.

      • addAttribute

        public static void addAttribute(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String value)
        Adds an attribute name and value to a string buffer.

        Performs any necessary escaping on the value. This should be used when you're building the XML for something, and its possible for an attribute value to have any of the characters &, ', or "
